meanings.definition: To protect too much or excessively.
meanings.sent1: She is always overprotecting her little brother, never letting him play outside alone.
meanings.sent2: Parents tend to overprotect their children out of love and concern for their safety.
meanings.sent3: The mother hen was overprotecting her chicks, even from harmless butterflies.
meanings.sent4: The security guard was overprotecting the VIP guest, making sure no one got too close.
meanings.sent5: The knight was overprotecting the princess, guarding her day and night from any danger.

meanings.definition: The act of providing excessive protection or care.
meanings.sent1: Overprotecting can sometimes hinder a child's ability to learn independence.
meanings.sent2: Some people believe that overprotecting can lead to a lack of resilience in individuals.
meanings.sent3: The overprotecting of fragile items in the museum made the visitors nervous to move around.
meanings.sent4: The overprotecting of the rare flower led to it wilting due to lack of exposure to sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The overprotecting of the elderly woman by her family made her feel suffocated and dependent.
